intro: Lithocardium toqueve, commonly known as the Andean stonecress, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or yellow flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Lithocardium toqueve is valued for its resilience and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
